meanings.definition: To come to live permanently in a foreign country.
meanings.sent1: My uncle immigrates to America last year.
meanings.sent2: Many families immigrate to new countries for better opportunities.
meanings.sent3: The cat thinks it will immigrate to the neighbor's house for more treats.
meanings.sent4: Her love for adventure makes her feel like she wants to immigrate to every corner of the world.
meanings.sent5: The idea of starting fresh in a new land and immigrating fills her with excitement.

meanings.definition: To enter and usually become established; especially: to come into a country of which one is not a native for permanent residence.
meanings.sent1: The birds immigrate to the garden every spring.
meanings.sent2: People often immigrate to seek a better life for themselves and their families.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a squirrel trying to immigrate into a bird's nest is quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: His passion for music makes him feel like the melodies immigrate into his soul.
meanings.sent5: The concept of cultures blending as people immigrate is fascinating to study.
